data.name: AppDescription_HelpText
data.value: The manifest creation command line utility generates manifest for submitting apps to the Windows Package Manager repo.

data.name: AppMoniker_KeywordDescription
data.value: The most common package term

data.name: Arch_KeywordDescription
data.value: The installer target architecture

data.name: Author_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package author

data.name: BrowserFailedToLaunch_Error
data.value: Web browser failed to launch: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the exception thrown when the browser fails to launch

data.name: ChangeOutputDirToCurrDir_Message
data.value: Output directory changed to current directory: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the current directory path

data.name: Channel_KeywordDescription
data.value: The distribution channel

data.name: ClearToken_Message
data.value: Clearing GitHub token cache

data.name: Clear_HelpText
data.value: Clear the cached GitHub token

data.name: Commands_KeywordDescription
data.value: List of commands or aliases to run the package

data.name: ConfirmGitHubSubmitManifest_Message
data.value: Would you like to submit your manifest to the Windows Package Manager repository?

data.name: CopyrightUrl_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package copyright page

data.name: Copyright_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package copyright

data.name: Custom_KeywordDescription
data.value: The custom installer switches

data.name: DefaultLocale_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package meta-data default locale |e.g. en-US|

data.name: Description_KeywordDescription
data.value: The full package description

data.name: DoneSymbol_String
data.value: DONE

data.name: DownloadFile_Error
data.value: Failed to download installer.

data.name: DownloadInstaller_Message
data.value: Downloading and parsing: {0}...
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the installer URL

data.name: EnterFollowingFields_Message
data.value: Please enter values for the following fields:

data.name: EnterUserCode_Message
data.value: Please enter the following user verification code when prompted: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the user verification code that must be entered in the GitHub OAuth webpage

data.name: Error_Prefix
data.value: ERROR: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced by the thrown exception message

data.name: Example_NewCommand_DownloadInstaller
data.value: Download installer and extract metadata
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the New Command that launches the manifest creation process with the user providing an installer URL to be downloaded and extracted.

data.name: Example_NewCommand_SaveLocallyOrSubmit
data.value: Save locally and submit a pull request
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the New Command that allows the user to decide where to save the newly-generated manifest locally and whether to submit directly to GitHub for a pull request.

data.name: Example_NewCommand_StartFromScratch
data.value: Start from scratch
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the New Command that launches the manifest creation process without any arguments.

data.name: Example_SubmitCommand_SubmitLocalManifest
data.value: Submit local manifest file to Windows Package Manager repo

data.name: Example_UpdateCommand_SaveAndPublish
data.value: Save and publish updated manifest

data.name: Example_UpdateCommand_SearchAndUpdateVersionAndInstallerURL
data.value: Search for an existing manifest and update the installer url and version
data.comment: Describes a usage scenario for the Update Command that pulls down a manifest by ID and updates the installer URL field and version field with the values provided by the user.

data.name: FileExtensions_KeywordDescription
data.value: List of file extensions the package could support

data.name: PathDoesNotExist_Warning
data.value: Path does not exist

data.name: Path_HelpText
data.value: Path to a manifest file or directory containing the manifests that you want to submit to the Windows Package Manager repo

data.name: GitHubFailedAuthorization_Message
data.value: GitHub authorization failed: {0} - {1}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with error code {1} - will be replaced with error description

data.name: GitHubLoginFail_Error
data.value: GitHub login failed.

data.name: GitHubToken_HelpText
data.value: GitHub personal access token used for direct submission to the Windows Package Manager repo. If no token is provided, tool will prompt for GitHub login credentials.

data.name: Heading
data.value: Windows Package Manager Manifest Creator v{0}
data.comment: {0} will be replaced with program's semantic version number

data.name: Homepage_KeywordDescription
data.value: The home page for the package

data.name: PackageIdentifier_HelpText
data.value: Package identifier used to lookup the existing manifest on the Windows Package Manager repo. Id is case-sensitive.

data.name: PackageIdentifier_KeywordDescription
data.value: The package unique identifier |e.g. Microsoft.VisualStudio|

data.name: InstallerArchitecture_KeywordDescription
data.value: The installer target architecture

data.name: InstallerSha256_KeywordDescription
data.value: The SHA256 installer hash

data.name: Installers_KeywordDescription
data.value: Collection of installers

data.name: InstallerType_KeywordDescription
data.value: The installer type

data.name: InstallerUrl_HelpText
data.value: Installer Url(s) used to extract relevant metadata for generating a manifest

data.name: InstallLocation_KeywordDescription
data.value: The installer location redirection path

data.name: Interactive_KeywordDescription
data.value: The interactive installer switches

data.value: Overrides default language

data.value: The installer log redirection path

data.value: Launches a series of questions to help generate a new manifest

data.value: Skipping pull request submission...

data.value: Submits a valid manifest directly to the Windows Package Manager repo

data.value: Submitting pull request for manifest...

data.name: SubmitToWinget_HelpText
data.value: Boolean value for submitting to the Windows Package Manager repo. If true, updated manifest will be submitted directly using the provided GitHub Token. Default is false.

data.value: The package version |e.g. 1.2.3.4|

data.value: The manifest type

data.value: The minimum version package dependency

data.value: List of restricted MSIX capabilities

data.value: The upgrade method

data.value: List of Windows feature dependencies

data.value: List of Windows library dependencies

data.name: MoreHelp_HelpText
data.value: More help can be found at: https://aka.ms/winget-create

data.name: PrivacyStatement_HelpText
data.value: Privacy statement: https://aka.ms/privacy

data.name: HttpResponseUnsuccessful_Error
data.value: HTTP response was unsuccessful. Status code: {0}
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the HTTP response status code

data.name: InvalidUrl_Error
data.value: Invalid URL provided. Please check the URL and try again.

data.name: PackageParsing_Error
data.value: Failed to parse the package from [{0}]
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the failed installer url

data.name: PackageIdAlreadyExists_Error
data.value: We have detected that this package identifier already exists. If you intend to update an existing package, please use the update command.

data.name: SettingsCommand_HelpText
data.value: Open settings

data.name: ErrorParsingSettingsFile_Message
data.value: Error parsing file: {0}.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the path to the settings file.

data.name: GenerateNewSettingsFile_Message
data.value: No settings file found, generating new settings file from loaded settings...

data.name: LoadSettingsFromBackup_Message
data.value: Loaded settings from backup file.

data.name: LoadSettingsFromDefault_Message
data.value: Loaded settings from default factory settings.

data.name: TelemetryAnonymous_Message
data.value: The data is anonymous and collected only by Microsoft.

data.name: TelemetryJustification_Message
data.value: The Windows Package Manager Manifest Creator collects usage data in order to improve your experience.

data.name: TelemetrySettings_Message
data.value: Telemetry Settings

data.name: UnexpectedErrorLoadSettings_Message
data.value: Unexpected error while loading settings. Please verify your settings by running the settings command.

data.name: CompareUpdatedManifestWithExisting_Message
data.value: Please ensure that the updated manifest you are submitting is different from the existing package.

data.name: InvalidTokenError_Message
data.value: Invalid token provided, please generate a new GitHub token and try again.

data.name: NoChangeDetectedInUpdatedManifest_Message
data.value: Submitting a manifest without any updated changes is not allowed.

data.name: InstallerMatchFailedError_Message
data.value: The following installers failed to match an existing installer node:

data.name: UnboundArguments_Message
data.value: The following unbound argument(s) were detected: "{0}"
data.comment: {0} - The additional unbound arguments present in the command line arguments.

data.name: VerifyCommandUsage_Message
data.value: Please check and verify the usage of this command by passing in the --help flag.

data.name: ModifyOptionalDefaultLocaleFields_Message
data.value: Would you like to modify the optional default locale fields?

data.name: NewInstallerUrlMustMatchExisting_Message
data.value: Each new installer URL must have a single match to an existing installer based on installer type and architecture. The following installers failed to match an existing installer:

data.name: DetectedArchMismatch_Message
data.value: The architecture detected from the binary might be different than what is specified in the installer URL for the following installer(s):

data.name: InstallerBinaryMismatch_Message
data.value: Using architecture detected from URL ({0}), overriding architecture detected from binary ({1})
data.comment: {0} - Architecture detected from the installer URL {1} - Architecture determined from the installer binary

data.name: RepositoryNotFound_Error
data.value: Repository "{0}/{1}" not found. Please verify the Windows Package Manager repository owner and name in your settings file.
data.comment: {0} - will be replaced with the owner name of the Windows Package Manager repository {1} - will be replaced with the name of the Windows Package Manager repository

data.name: CacheCommand_HelpText
data.value: Manage downloaded installers stored in cache

data.name: Clean_HelpText
data.value: Deletes all downloaded installers in the cache folder

data.name: List_HelpText
data.value: Lists out all the downloaded installers stored in cache

data.name: Open_HelpText
data.value: Opens the cache folder storing the downloaded installers

data.name: InstallersFound_Message
data.value: {0} installers found in {1}
data.comment: {0} - Will be replaced with the number of installers found in the cache folder {1} - Will be replaced with the path to the downloaded installer cache folder

data.name: DeletingInstaller_Message
data.value: Deleting {0}
data.comment: {0} - Will be replaced with the name of the installer to be deleted.

data.name: InstallerCacheCleaned_Message
data.value: Installer cache cleaned.

data.name: DeletingInvalidCachedToken_Message
data.value: Cached token was invalid, deleting token from cache...

data.name: InvalidGitHubToken_Message
data.value: Token was invalid. Please generate a new GitHub token and try again.

data.name: RateLimitExceeded_Message
data.value: GitHub api rate limit exceeded. To extend your rate limit, provide your GitHub token with the '-t' flag or store one using the 'token --store' command.
data.comment: '-t' refers to a command line switch argument 'token --store' refers to a command line argument

data.name: SettingToken_Message
data.value: Setting GitHub token...

data.name: StoringToken_Message
data.value: Token stored in cache successfully.

data.name: GetLatestVersion_Message
data.value: For the latest version ({0}), go to {1}
data.comment: {0} - Will be replaced with the latest release version {1} - Will be replaced with the URL to the latest version of the tool.

data.name: OutdatedVersionNotice_Message
data.value: This is an older version of Winget-Create and may be missing some critical features.

data.name: UpgradeUsingWinget_Message
data.value: If you have the winget client installed, you can update by running the command: `winget upgrade Microsoft.WingetCreate`
data.comment:
`winget upgrade Microsoft.WingetCreate` refers to a specific command to be executed in order to upgrade the tool to the latest version.
"winget" is the proper name of the tool

data.name: TelemetryEnabledByDefault_Message
data.value: By default, telemetry is enabled but can be disabled by running `wingetcreate settings` and editing your settings file.
data.comment: `wingetcreate settings` refers to a specific command to be executed if the user wants to modify their settings.

data.name: DownloadFileExceedsMaxSize_Error
data.value: URL points to file larger than the maximum size of {0}MB
data.comment: {0} - represents the maximum size of a downloaded file

data.name: InstallerCountMustMatch_Error
data.value: The number of new installer packages must match the number of existing installer packages.

data.name: MultipleMatchedInstaller_Error
data.value: Multiple matches found for {0} {1} installer detected from the url: {2}
data.comment:
{0} - will be replaced with installer architecture
{1} - will be replaced with the installer type
{2} - will be replaced with the installer

data.name: UnmatchedInstaller_Error
data.value: No matches found for {0} {1} installer detected from url: {2}
data.comment:
{0} - will be replaced with installer architecture
{1} - will be replaced with the installer type {2} - will be replaced with the installer

data.name: AdditionalMetadataNeeded_Message
data.value: Additional metadata needed for installer from {0}
data.comment: {0} - Installer URL of the installer

data.name: Add_MenuItem
data.value: ADD

data.name: AllInstallers_MenuItem
data.value: ALL INSTALLERS

data.name: Back_MenuItem
data.value: BACK

data.name: DisplayPreviewOfItems
data.value: Displaying preview of [{0}]:
data.comment: {0} - Name of field with list of items

data.name: DisplayPreviewOfSelectedInstaller_Message
data.value: Displaying a preview of the selected installer:

data.name: DisplayPreview_MenuItem
data.value: DISPLAY PREVIEW

data.name: Done_MenuItem
data.value: DONE

data.name: FieldValueIs_Message
data.value: [{0}] value is
data.comment: {0} - Name of the field

data.name: FilterMenuItems_Message
data.value: Filter menu items by typing a search query below.

data.name: ModifyOptionalInstallerFields_Message
data.value: Would you like to modify the optional installer fields?

data.name: None_MenuItem
data.value: NONE

data.name: RemoveLastEntry_MenuItem
data.value: REMOVE LAST ENTRY

data.name: SelectAction_Message
data.value: What would you like to do?

data.name: SelectInstallerToEdit_Message
data.value: Which installer would you like to edit?

data.name: SelectPropertyToEdit_Message
data.value: Which property would you like to edit?

data.name: InteractiveUpdate_HelpText
data.value: Boolean value for making the update command interactive. If true, the tool will prompt the user for input. Default is false.

data.name: InstallerUpdatedSuccessfully_Message
data.value: Installer updated successfully!

data.name: NewInstallerUrl_Message
data.value: What is the new installer url?

data.name: PressKeyToContinue_Message
data.value: Press any key to continue...

data.name: UpdatingInstallerOutOfTotal_Message
data.value: Updating {0} of {1} installers:
data.comment: {0} - represents the current installer index that is being updated {1} - represents the total number of installers to be updated

data.name: DiscardUpdateAndStartOver_Message
data.value: Would you like to discard this update and start over?

data.name: ResolveMatchingConflicts_Message
data.value: To resolve matching conflicts manually, use the --interactive flag.
data.comment: `--interactive` - refers to a flag that can be included with the command

data.name: DefenderVirus_ErrorMessage
data.value: Operation did not complete successfully because the downloaded file contains a virus or potentially unwanted software. For more information on potentially unwanted software and what options are available, see https://aka.ms/winget-create-security

data.name: InstallerSelection_MenuItem
data.value: INSTALLER {0}: {1}
data.comment: {0} - represents the installer index number {1} - represents the associated installer metadata

data.name: EditManifests_Message
data.value: Would you like to edit your manifests?

data.name: SaveAndExit_MenuItem
data.value: SAVE AND EXIT

data.name: SelectManifestToEdit_Message
data.value: Which manifest do you want to edit?
